website_summaries.verdict: More than just fun, it's a great game for honing critical thinking skills for both kids and adults. But if you are looking for a game for younger kids, it may be too advanced.
pros: Strategy is the object of this game, which helps kids learn to focus and concentrate
Easy to learn, but challenging to master
Ideal for kids ages 7 and older
cons: Small pieces feel cheaply made, and get lost easily – some owners wish it came with a case to keep track of all the components

website_summaries.verdict: More than just fun, it's a great game for honing critical thinking skills for both kids and adults, but if you are looking for a game for younger kids, it may be too advanced.
pros: Strategy is the object of this game, and helps kids learn to focus and concentrate
Easy to learn, but challenging to master
Ideal for kids age 7 and older
cons: Small pieces feel cheaply made, and get lost easily – some owners wish it came with a case to keep track of all the components

customer_reviews.title: There is no such thing as “Deluxe” Blokus. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this version and the $17.99 “regular” version. See attached photos. They are identical. The only difference is a bar-code sticker on the back. Confirmed with Mattel. No such thing as Deluxe.
customer_reviews.author: David Pinkus

customer_reviews.title: Tiles slide all over the place, making this difficult for little kids
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the nice version of this game that my son had at his preschool. Unfortunately, this is a much more cheaply made version, where there are almost no ridges for the tiles to sit in, so the tiles end up sliding around very easily. Super-frustrating for little kids who are still working on their motor skills. I would not have bought this if I'd realized this would happen.
customer_reviews.author: nem

customer_reviews.title: An adequate version of this game.
customer_reviews.text: The board in this set measures 11 3/4 inches square, not the promised 13 inches square. The board does have the full 400 squares. The pieces are less substantial and a bit smaller than in the original version, although I wouldn't call them fragile. There are 21 pieces of each color, as their should be. So this may not be the version, physically, you are thinking about if you have played this game somewhere else. However, this is still the same fun game to enjoy with friends or family. Keep in mind that Blokus really is a game for four players.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Doom

customer_reviews.title: Game is fun, but arrived in rough shape.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, but was delivered without any packaging at all. The game arrived with the ships labeled attached right to the game box. There was no plastic protecting it, so it’s a big white sticker mess stuck on the brand new game for ever. The box isn’t that strong, so it is slightly dented as well. I can’t give it now as the Easter Bunny gift I was planning on. We played it as a family game and it was fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Kidman

customer_reviews.title: Attached shipping labels directly to game box, not cool
customer_reviews.text: We bought the game because we had fun playing it with friends. The game itself is great! I highly recommend it. What I am not happy about is that Amazon affixed the three shipping labels directly to the game box and just taped the game box shut (not even any plastic wrap between the stickers and the box). After a few aggravating moments I was able to peel the shipping stickers off, but now I have sticky residue all over the box. Amazon, for board game enthusiasts the integrity of the game box is VERY important. You are going to have very unhappy customers if you ship games out this way.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our 5-year old can play it but it's also lots (more?) fun for us adults! The only issue we have with it that it is for four people. If you play it with three people then you have to take turns (across rounds) in playing the fourth player. The person who is in between the two other real players has therefore a disadvantage! So unfortunately, we have stopped playing it. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: allis

customer_reviews.title: retailer lacks any care
customer_reviews.text: I bought Blokus to replace an old one I already owned, which I absolutely love. The game is a really fun activity for kids and adults alike. However, the issue is really the retailer. The game arrived with a sticker on the box of the actual game. Yes, you read correctly... no shipping box. And I am sure you can already predict that the box is badly damaged. To say the apathy and lack of care is incredibly infuriating is an understatement. I can't even imagine what a lower level of customer service would entail... charging me and not sending the game. Won't even waste more of my time further sharing my thoughts.... This is an Amazon Exclusive...
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes

customer_reviews.title: A Classic game, but in poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend because quality problems and shipping problem. (1) wrong piece. The red has two straight fives and misses one straight four. (2) the board does not provide good grips, it doesn’t hold the pieces securely in place as the junior set does. It's so frustrating when pieces were easily messed up with a slightest touch. (3) it was shipped as is, no wrapping, not even a piece of paper. It was left on the ground. Which we won’t have minded too much if there was no problem with the previous two defects!
customer_reviews.author: SoCal-mom

customer_reviews.title: Not the classic version.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered "blokus classic" (the larger version pictured here) and paid about $35 for it. Was sent the smaller, newer, cheaper version instead. I could have gotten that version much cheaper anywhere else. I must agree with the other reviewer who said this is a typical bait & switch. I am attempting to send it back. I'm not sure if the classic version is available anywhere at all. I guess there's no way to tell for sure what you'll get from the seller. It's not like I didn't check first, I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Jo

customer_reviews.title: great game, terrible shipping
customer_reviews.text: the game includes great strategy and spacial relations. We have sent it to each of our adult kids and their family's love it. Our 5 year old grandkids can play it but the adults enjoy it too and play it without the kids around! Our ONLY complaint is with the shipping. 2 of the 3 shipments had the shipping label attached directly to the game without any box. Very poor and awful if you are giving it as a gift. Great game, poor shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Valeri

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the Deluxe version -- It is what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Blockus is a classic game, but after the initial release, Hasbro sold a smaller version that was just annoying. For many years I felt I couldn't gift this game to anyone because it was too small and that made playing it difficult. Finally, after years of waiting, they've re-released the bigger version. It's still not "quite" as big as the original, but it's close enough for me to feel comfortable buying again. My girlfriend was overjoyed when this showed up on her doorstep!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Pitstick

customer_reviews.title: Exercise your mind on angles without Kids realizing they’re doing that
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! Originally played at our friend’s condo on vacation and we couldn’t get enough of it so had to purchase it for Christmas. Best part is that it helps exercise your mind in how angles fit together and strategy of how you can create a scenario to get all your pieces down despite your opponents moves. We even gave the 2 player version to friends and will probably gift one of these to someone in the future too.
customer_reviews.author: The Clever Panda

customer_reviews.title: Be aware!  Not the classic 13X13 version.  False advertising!
customer_reviews.text: Here's my first 1 star review. Because the false advertising. I paid $35 including shipping for this version, because, according to its website, it is a older version which is bigger and suitable for a 6 years old (5+), while there is a newer version which is smaller and lower in price, only 18.11 and shipping fee free (for prime, who I am). When I receive the item, guess what? is the newer smaller and lower price version! I then check the 1 star reviews, it turns out that I am the only one who encounter this problem. I am very unhappy and am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: cristina chen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game but shipped without a box?
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE this game so I am giving it five stars but I can't quite figure out why Amazon thinks it is okay to tape the game box closed, slap a shipping label on it and ship it to me like that? I take very good care of my things and now I have a brand new game with a label on it. If I rip it off it will rip the box. Not okay. Thank god I didn't buy it as a gift for someone!
customer_reviews.author: Krista B

customer_reviews.title: Good game, but the picture is misleading on the game edition
customer_reviews.text: The game is great but the picture is misleading. You will not get the deluxe option for age of 5 and higher, but the normal edition for 7 and higher at the more expensive price. This happened to me twice even after being reassured by customer service that second time, I will receive the right one. But I was not requested to send back the first one and the game itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: Radu Pitish

customer_reviews.title: Shipped in It's Own Box
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of saving trees. But slapping two slickers on the box and shipping it makes it impossible to give this game as a gift which in our case, fortunately, it was not. BUT when I tried to get one of the stickers off, it ripped the box and it ain't pretty. So perhaps there is a happy medium. Did not love your method of shipping at all
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: The game pictured is great, it's the perfect game for two smart adult ...
customer_reviews.text: The game pictured is great, it's the perfect game for two smart adult couples to enjoy an evening. This is not that game. The picture is of the much higher quality older version, which is worth the higher price. I paid the higher price, but like so many others, got the newer, smaller, cheaper version which is very poorly made. I was purposely looking for this older version, this is very deceptive and as revealed by the other angry and disappointing victims, these crooks have been at it for years. Do not waste your money. Find the real thing from a reputable seller.
customer_reviews.author: Selqet

customer_reviews.title: A great family game
customer_reviews.text: I like it because its really easy to learn. It’s a mind game and I enjoyed playing it with my husband. It’s a family game actually. My 8-year old daughter learned it fast and my 6-year old son enjoys it too. But both my kids do not play until the end if we, adults take sooo much time thinking where to place our tiles. So when playing with kids, better for adults to think and act fast so kids don’t lose the interest of finishing the game.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne F.

customer_reviews.title: Shipping label on game box
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed that the game was shipped in the games own box so there are TWO shipping labels on the box and some other random sorting sticker. Why not at least bag it? Shipping labels will no come off (as the are designed to NOT come off). Looks like junk. Why would I pay full price for something that looks used. Game is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lori S

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Great game, my family has been playing this game for decades and we just bought a 2nd set because a few pieces ended up missing throughout the years. Make sure you put each color pieces in a separate zip lock bag to easily separate the colors pieces and to not lose them.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Game Box Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I thought there would be some type of protection for this Game, like celophane, et al. Both of the gift packages were damaged. This was the first time I had opted for no box. I will never do that again. Both of the receivers had to scrap off the sticky shipping labels. Really tacky shipping option. Not a good PR move. I was very disappointed. J. Miller
customer_reviews.author: Joalyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: We played this game with adults and children as young as 6. Everyone enjoyed it! The kids may or may not fully grasp the strategic aspects of the game, but they can understand the simple rules and have fun playing it. As an adult, I enjoyed playing a game with children that was also challenging for me. (I don't like the typical kiddie board games.) The game can be played in 20-30 minutes, so it's great for those who don't like long involved games, and people with shorter attention spans. Highly recommend for both adult game enthusiasts and for playing as a family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the game, board was damaged
customer_reviews.text: I loved playing Blokus in High School, wanted to get it again to reminisce. The packaging that it came in was beat up and broken along with part of the actual board. Was expecting a bit of damage to the package, not the actual game pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Postage directly on game :-(
customer_reviews.text: We like the game but whoever shipped it didn’t put it in a separate box and just put the postage directly on the box!!! Now it’ll be stuck there for as long as we have the game. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Fun Family Game for up to 4 Players
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play for 2 to 4 players. You need to be careful when opening up and packing up the game pieces as they are susceptible to getting misplaced and sometimes lost. Missing pieces can affect the outcome of a game.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Poppleton

customer_reviews.title: fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun game. My grandchildren, ages 4-6 were able to understand how to play with almost no help, other than teaching them strategy. If only two people are playing, either play two colors each or block off part of the board or it is too easy.
customer_reviews.author: jg grandma

customer_reviews.title: NOT as described
customer_reviews.text: I had the "deluxe" version of Blokus at home with a big board and sturdy pieces. I've wanted to give it as a gift but the version I saw in stores has a small board/pieces. When I saw the deluxe game on Amazon with the bigger board, I ordered it as a gift. What I received was NOT the deluxe version as listed in the item description but the cheaper version I could've gotten cheaper elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: FunnyHats

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't a cheap game, it wasn't put in a box and they put the shipping label right on the game box! It's corners are all bashed up and looks like something old that you'd get from a garage sale. Sending it back and will buy it somewhere else!
customer_reviews.author: David Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great brain game
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game for the mind. Really makes a person think and strategically plan out their moves. Every game is different. No repeat board situations. As far as for a travel game, it's ok for a table but not for playing in a car.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Witschonke

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and not the Blokus you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: This appears more like a cheap fake. The game box is of very poor quality, the quality of the components is also poorer than the original Mattel version. Overall, if you've ever played Blokus, you won't enjoy this game. If you've never played it and this option is priced better at the moment, get it and you'll enjoy it because the game itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Shygimaga

customer_reviews.title: Condition of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Torn up Box and Black ink all around Box, Especially with Covid-19
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Jojola

customer_reviews.title: Another Convert - when do I get my cadillac?
customer_reviews.text: We love it! We got our friend into board games with this - she previously only thought she liked Carcassonne. We have since fed her a steady diet of highly-visual and spatial games, so she now loves this, Ingenious, Ticket to Ride, a few word games, and the Discworld game. Success! My one complaint is that it only plays well with 4. There are modifications for 2 or 3 players, but they aren't great, and I don't recommend them. I'm waiting for Blokus Trigon to go on sale, as that scales better, but it seems to be out of print. Regardless, this is a better starting game than Trigon, because it's even more visual.
customer_reviews.author: IrishFire

customer_reviews.title: Classic, Simple, and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I love Blokus! Such a simple concept, but always challenging and fun. I first played this in my high school math class. Now I'm a high school math teacher, so I got myself a copy for my own class! It will strengthen spacial and sequencing skills. You really have to think ahead and build strategies with this one, but it is easy and simple to play and understand. I bought a used version of the Deluxe game for cheap here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: dawn767Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fun and addicting game
customer_reviews.text: We first played this with my family and learned within minutes. I had to buy this for my little family so I got it on Amazon. We love this game. It is really fun and challenging, and you cannot just play one round.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Oyama

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: My nephew (9) loves this game! He would rather play this than video games when he visits me so I sent one to him to practice for his visits with Auntie. The whole family can play and it is easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette K. Pryor

customer_reviews.title: Fun game.
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to this game during a girls' beach weekend several years ago. A good strategy game appropriate for kids and adults. I even used it at school with middle schoolers. I like this version because the board and pieces are a bit larger than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS GAME
customer_reviews.text: I loved this game so much it’s an amazing family game me and my family have played this game more then 25 times now, and we just got it a month ago, we played it almost every night, it’s so easy to learn and takes thinking which helps us learn well playing the fun game. The game was well worth the money spent, buy this game your family will love it.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 4th grader for Christmas. We ended up playing it with grandparents, great uncles, aunts, cousins, ages 6-90 and everyone had fun. I ended up buying two more for gifts. It's starts off easy (so you can learn the game easily) bit gets trickier and requires more strategy as the gameboarr fills up. Our family preferred to work together to complete the game instead of "blokusing" the opponents. Either way is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle33

customer_reviews.title: Simple to learn and teach, hard to play well.
customer_reviews.text: The game has few rules, so it's easy to learn and teach, but successful play requires a careful blend of offensive and defensive thinking. Very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: kitguy25

customer_reviews.title: Our Family’s New Favorite Game!
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 sons ranging in ages 10-18 and they all, along with myself and my husband, enjoy this game. It’s hard to find games that everyone will get into, especially my husband who is not fond of board games. But he’s actually asking the kids if they want to play! Super fun and easy to get hooked on! Our family’s new favorite game!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Try It!
customer_reviews.text: My family first played this at a boba tea shop. After trying it out, we had to get one for ourselves. The kids love it! We play it almost every week.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I received this game as a Christmas present. We immediately fell in love with playing it as it is a great strategy/thinking game for adults--great for 2-4 players. The pieces are plastic and small so I would not recommend this game for younger kids--as they can easily put it in their mouth, swallow it, choke on it, etc. More of a game for high school students and above. This game test your mind's ability to analyze and think about geometric shapes and figures---great for visual-spatial people. We loved this game so much, we ordered one for a friend of ours and gave it to them as a gift. Would highly recommend to anyone who loves board games!
customer_reviews.author: Truman H.

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: Blokus is a really fun game that we love to play. It is great for two or four people. Even young kids (probably 8-up) will catch on and do great. My family really enjoys this game.
customer_reviews.author: Reads2Escape

customer_reviews.title: A great family game.
customer_reviews.text: The board groves were a little shallow for holding the pieces in place and would pop out fairly easily. But it is a great game, especially for people who have a good sense of space perception.
customer_reviews.author: Betty,

customer_reviews.title: Blokus Game
customer_reviews.text: While this is a terrific game and I purchased it as a gift. The game arrived with no packaging and the address and shipping labels were on the game box itself.... Trying to take the stickers off (3) made the game box a bit unattractive.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Shipping by Amazon horrible
customer_reviews.text: Amazon decided to ship this item without an enclosing box. So they just slapped a few labels on the outside of the game box and sent it. Box was completely destroyed in the process. Dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blokus
customer_reviews.text: I Love this game......my daughter had it and brought it over for game night and i loved it enough to order it as soon as she left.......LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: jenjen

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite games
customer_reviews.text: This game has the right mix of elements. I hate games that are all chance but have no strategy. This game has a good amount of stratagey without being difficult to learn and without taking too long to play which is the problem with a lot of strategy games. Then no one wants to play. You can teach Blokus in a few minutes, takes ~30 minutes to play and after you have played once or twice you can already begin to see all of the stratagey, but this game still has tons of replayability. Very fun if you are looking for a quick strategy game that people will actually play.
customer_reviews.author: Giuce

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Easy to Learn
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old first played Blokus at school, and had so much fun that he asked me to get this for our family game night. It's very easy to learn, and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael O.

customer_reviews.title: super fun game
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves it. Super entertaining and helps my kid to grow sense of strategy. Love this types of games!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Waston

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Game of all!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this game it is super fun and easy enough yet challenging enough for everyone from my 5 yr old to the genius that I am (that's a joke). After being disappointed by lame games such as Sorry Sliders, Trapdoor Checkers and Mousetrap, it is easy to be wary of lame games where it seems that the makers sat around drunk and made up the rules. Even I Spy Eagle Eye was sort of a let down, it could've been SO much better if they just hadn't cheaped out on the number of cards included in the game. Blokus is a sure fire win, it's sort of like Tetris and Dominoes combined, pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: CCD

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn but quite challenging when played correctly. Board is a little thin and pieces don’t always stay in place during play. Fun game
customer_reviews.author: jimmychoo

customer_reviews.title: great fun quick strategy
customer_reviews.text: Needed to add something to our pandemic lives kids were/are driving me nuts! we love puzzle, strategy games this one fits the whole fam. Easy to play
customer_reviews.author: thora

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old enjoyed it. I'd recommend playing with 3-4 players to ...
customer_reviews.text: When we played this the first time, there were just two of us and it was quite simple. When we added a player we saw how it can get trickier. My 8 year old enjoyed it. I'd recommend playing with 3-4 players to keep it a bit more challenging and interesting. (My 5 yo wanted to play with us but really did not understand the corner to corner placement of the blocks. He took it out later and tried to play it like one would play Tetris.)
customer_reviews.author: LaurenH

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the family
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun for all ages. It takes strategy but even then you can win with luck. Perfect game for the whole family to play. Brings fun back to family game night.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Winner for a family of six.
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! We are a family of six, so sometimes we have to team up, but even my four-year-old boy loves it. It's a favorite of my ten-year-old girl. Her and I play it more than anyone, but everyone loves it. It makes you think and gives you a challenge. My six-year-old girl greatly improved from when we first received it, and my four-year-old doesn't quite get exactly how it's played, but he gets the basics; we just have to point him in the right direction, which is why we sometimes team up.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie A Gabbard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and play, more fun to master!
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! It's like 4 player tetris where none of the pieces dissapear. Easy for kids to learn and play, fun and strategic enough for adults to enjoy too!
customer_reviews.author: Just some guy

customer_reviews.title: F is for friends who do stuff together...
customer_reviews.text: Just a really great 4 player game. This amazon version is the old style larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great family gift and for the adults too!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter and her family last Christmas. When I read reviews that the new Blokus game was smaller and had duller game pieces, I searched all over the internet for this older version that didn't cost twice the face value. I found out this Christmas that it was their favorite game and the adults enjoyed playing it just as much, if not more, that the kids! My adult children play it with their friends and get quite lively.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca of Sunnybrook

customer_reviews.title: One of the best games ever - very fun - very accessible - for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who likes board games or games in general should enjoy this. Kids 5 and up (maybe even younger) could figure this out and play it and have a great time. As some have mentioned, it isn't for 3 players although there is a way to play it like this. It is best with 2 or 4 people. We've played this game many times and it is a favorite of everyone. I'd recommend the Blokus Trigon too. I think it is slightly more interesting as a game but the geometric shapes in this version are probably more fun for younger players. I can't recommend this game enough.
customer_reviews.author: A. DeHart

customer_reviews.title: Easy, tidy, fast, great for adults or kids or both!
customer_reviews.text: My family loved playing this! 5, 7, 26 and 27yr olds. We unboxed it, read the three step instructions on the back and had a blast!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander/Shannin

customer_reviews.title: Great family game to get you thinking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game that is easy to learn and tons of fun. I stopped trying to explain too much when teaching people how to play this game. Run them through the basics and play one round and then everyone is good to go. This is a great game to get kids and adults thinking about spacial relationships. A nice change of pace from most of the other games that are out these these days. This is a fun game for 2-4 players that you actually have to think about to play. I think 3 players has a fun variation with the 4th color rotated around, lots of twists and turns.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.text: Got this a couple of days ago and we’ve played this all weekend! 10 yr old kids love it and adults do too. It’s deceptively simple to play but requires a lot of strategy.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game. Gets kids thinking and using their brains to develop a strategy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Rutkowski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Board Game
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I really enjoy playing European style board games, but our young sons (ages 6 & 4) have started to want to play with us, so we looked for something that we would all enjoy playing together. Blokus fits the bill. My 6 year old understands the concept very well and I like that this game teaches strategy and spacial thinking skills. My four year old likes to play too, but he struggles with the idea of only placing the pieces with corners touching. I think he'll grow into it in a few months. This is a game that is easy to learn and lots of fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: WishesUT

customer_reviews.title: Fun and a Challenge
customer_reviews.text: Got this game never playing it before. I love games that are like puzzles and take strategy to win. Well this game is that. It more fun with more players, upto 4 players can play. I noticed it is way to easy when it is two people playing. But then again it all depends how you play. The idea is to use all your pieces and at the same time block the other player from putting in their pieces. It's fun and gets you to think. Great family game or games for the kids to play.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: Great game, almost Tetris like. Very simple to learn however it will force you to strategize and plan ahead each move.
customer_reviews.author: Evan G.

customer_reviews.title: I'm Addicted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game about 2 months ago, and since have played it dozens of times with my two 4 year-old boys (they are very capable of playing well), my husband, and my parents, for whom I purchased their own Blokus. Every game is different, and it's so fun to see my boys' skills progress. Great equalizer, as there are many strategies that can be employed at different levels of abilities. We haven't lost a piece, yet, either. LOVE it! So much more educational and fun than Candyland and other games that are entirely based on luck. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Good for all ages! Makes you think!!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for all ages... Makes you think! Bought one for me and gave one as a gift. Played with grandkid.... they loved it.
customer_reviews.author: MT HOOD DAVE

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces.  Check Immediately Upon Receiving.
customer_reviews.text: We love the game, but can only play with three players maximum due to pieces missing from the yellow bag. This was a Christmas present and the time between purchase and playing this wasn't discovered in time to remedy the problem. Contacts through Mattel customer service provided no results, not even an email acknowledging we were heard. Otherwise, totally fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Our New Favorite Game
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 year old, and a 16 year old. Both love to play this game. It’s a great game... Fast Delivery! I bought the Deluxe.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my 7-year-old son's favorite game! My 5-year-old likes it, but sometimes she struggles with the concept. (Our runner-ups are Sequence For Kids and The Kids of Carcassonne.) Prior reviewers have listed the rules of play and alternative methods, so I'll refrain from discussing in my review. I will say that it never gets boring for the adults--which I find to be great as my son wants to play over and over again. The game and pieces have been holding up well to our 3 months (and counting) of game playing. I am glad I listened to the reviews. The game does not disappoint! Great, great game!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMember

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: Great fun and enough space on the board to play a game that takes a minute but not all night. We enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: Amy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: One of the best family games out there. It is all about startegy. I strongly recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Camou Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun puzzle-strategy game with straight-forward directions.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how I got to the age of 25 without playing this game but the day after I played it, I knew I had to purchase it. Blokus was surprisingly hard to find. I purchased it here immediately when I found it. It was quite pricey, but all games are I guess. It's a super fun game to play with your family. It includes strategy and brain power. It definitely brings out the competitiveness in my family.
customer_reviews.author: caitpre

customer_reviews.title: This is a high quality game!
customer_reviews.text: This is very well made and fun to play for kids and adults. It is the official large version of this great game for 4 players. Made by Mattel.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: My family loves strategy games and this one is fun and easy. Doesn't take a long time to play. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Laws

customer_reviews.title: We loved this game.
customer_reviews.text: This is the larger game, which is why we purchased this one. Very good family game.
customer_reviews.author: Great travel's

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for family entertainment.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn to play (10 minutes) and still have conversations while playing. Virtually all ages can play and enjoy together. Great for multi-generational vacation time together. Played it once and bought it to have for creating fun time together with my grandchildren (who loved competing and beating their elders) and it led to some unguarded conversations that were then main motivation in buying. Trying to make time together enjoyable for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Oaklandben

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed this game so we bought this to gift to someone else in the family. I'm sure they will enjoy it as we have.
customer_reviews.author: Gao Agong

customer_reviews.title: Family fun!
customer_reviews.text: Love this strategy game that my 9- year old can learn! Fun family game that will engage your brain 🙂
customer_reviews.author: JillisaC

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for entire family
customer_reviews.text: Now this is a fun game for the entire family! The kids (6-8) enjoy it and ask to play it wth each other. It has been three weeks and they are just as excited to play as when they first received the gift. Good staying power! Strategy, easy scoring, and a relatively quick game for short attention spans. a+
customer_reviews.author: LovinParents

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: This is another good game without a lot of stuff to figure out-but is also deceptively strategic. Kids and adults alike can enjoy. It will not work if pieces are lost. Something to keep in mind if you have kids that aren't good at putting it away completely.
customer_reviews.author: oldmomma

customer_reviews.title: Great family game for 2 or 4 players
customer_reviews.text: The kids and I all love to play this game. Ages 9-54.
customer_reviews.author: BKeen

customer_reviews.title: I PLAY ALONE
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed playing this alone, I play all 4 colors, endless quiet challenge and fun. Heard of this game on Carol Tuttle's site. Spot on for T4s!
customer_reviews.author: Down to Earth Reader

customer_reviews.title: We love playing with our 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: We love playing with our 5 year old. She's fantastic at Blokus! The whole family has a great time playing!! Works best with a minimum of 3 players but we've had fun playing with 2.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for the Family
customer_reviews.text: There's just something about owning the actual game rather than purchasing it on a game system or a tablet. We're trying to pull away from the electronics and have more family game nights and this is a great game to add to our board game collection that's slowly growing. My three year old and 9 year old request to play this game almost every night. There's not much to it, but the strategy behind the game is what makes it interesting and fun to play, and them knowing the simple instructions is all it takes to smoothly play the game without having to reiterate the instructions. I recommend this game for any family!
customer_reviews.author: V. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy box and plastic game board & pieces. A good game that's not difficult to learn but can be played again & again and trains spatial thinking. ... Kind of like Tetris :D ... Both my 7 & 10 year olds enjoy it. But beware, there are some colored block pieces are pretty small (3/8" square) and can get easily lost or swallowed :O ... so keep away from babies & small kids. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: plc

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great game for the entire family, kids and adults. Challenging, but easy and a lot of fun. Each time you play the game changes. Best of all it allows you family time and gets the kids off the electronic for a while. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is a great game
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 year old and a 6 year old and they both love to play this game. It teaches strategy and requires the players to think about what their next move is at each stage of the game. Some games when it isn't the players turn can't hold the kids attention because they role a dice and go a few places or pull a card and do what it says. This game requires the player to always pay attention and think about their next move. We have had so much fun we bought it for 2 other kids and they both love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: @hibbisonmike

customer_reviews.title: Our top game for the season
customer_reviews.text: Very fun challenging game, but very easy to learn and play
customer_reviews.author: alb1957

customer_reviews.title: We love this game
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! It's our second one. The game arrived quickly. However, the game box itself is worn, indicating a used game, which is fine. But there is a tag on the box stating which pieces are missing! That's totally not cool. We still have pieces from our other game....so maybe I can replace what's missing. But used & missing pieces was not listed when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Teri F

customer_reviews.title: A definite MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our family's favorite board games! It's one that truly only takes 30 minutes to play, so even with so little time at the end of a day, this game allows us to spend quality time together! Also, a huge plus is that this game is awesome as an educational tool for younger kids. All the game pieces are in different shapes and have different number of tiles. It makes you think about the number and shape as you place each piece on the game board. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: runtherace

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Learn
customer_reviews.text: I host a weekly game night for strategy type games (mostly EURO), but needed a game that was easy to learn by nongamers, had play under 30 minutes, could be played with 2 people, and challenging enough to engage experienced gamers...this fit the bill! It makes a great starter game, close of evening game, or something quick to play while waiting for other games to open up seats. Everyone in my group who has played this really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Simple Fun
customer_reviews.text: Any age could play this game. It is simple enough that they would enjoy it and strategic enough for more skilled players
customer_reviews.author: anm

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun game.  It involves strategy but not complicated.
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun. Takes less than an hour to play. Strategy involved but it is not chess. You can play & converse.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Canino

customer_reviews.title: Great family strategy game!
customer_reviews.text: We tried to get this game a couple of years ago for Christmas, but couldn't find it anywhere for a price we wanted to pay (read: ebay was outrageous!). Finally, we got it this year, and the entire family (all adults except one child) has been having a great time figuring out the strategies. It's a game that's easy enough to understand that you can jump right in and play, but the level of competition can make it a really long or really short game. It's a blast! Every home with games should have this one!
customer_reviews.author: T. Leary

customer_reviews.title: No Pride in product
customer_reviews.text: The game is great but the package came just as beat up as if it was used and abused
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Great game!!
customer_reviews.text: One of our favorite games. During our move we lost this and I couldn’t find the original in stores. So happy I found this here!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun. It is best played with 4 players even though there are ways of playing it with fewer players. It is a game of strategy that appears simple at first, but the more you play it, the more you get to appreciate the strategy.
customer_reviews.author: MarieNY

product_meta.title: Blokus Game [Amazon Exclusive]
product_meta.description:
Stake your claim and protect your territory with the Blokus game! It takes less than a minute to learn, but offers endless strategy and fun challenges for the whole family. Each player gets a set of 21 pieces – in red, blue, green, or yellow – then takes turns placing them on the board. There's just one rule: each piece you play must touch at least one other piece of the same color, but only at the corners! The goal is to fit the most pieces on the board. The game ends when no more pieces can be placed down, and the player with the lowest number remaining wins! For players 7 years and older.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: ​Perfect strategy game for the whole family -- less than a minute to learn with fun challenges for all ages!​
​ Players take turns placing their 21 pieces on the board: each piece must touch another of the same color, but only at the corners!
​ Stake your claim and protect your territory by fitting as many of your pieces on the board as possible while strategically blocking your opponents!
​ The game ends when no more pieces can be placed down, and the player with the lowest number remaining wins!
